hero.title: Building software with purpose
hero.subtitle: Software Engineering • Secure Development • Web
hero.description: I'm João Victor, a software developer and Computer Science student at UFPE. I work on building robust web applications, combining software engineering, best practices, and a strong focus on information security and data protection.

about.title: About Me
paragraphs: I'm a Computer Science student at the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) and a software developer with hands-on experience in web applications, APIs, and systems used by real users.
My foundation is Software Engineering: architecture, code quality, maintainability, scalability, and best practices are part of my daily work as a developer.

In parallel, I've been diving deeper into Information Security and secure development, with special attention to data protection, access control, principle of least privilege, authentication, authorization, and compliance.
I believe that well-built software needs to be functional, sustainable, and secure. That's why I always seek to align solid engineering with a security-first mindset from the start of development.
hobbies: I'm passionate about football and follow all matches of Sport Club do Recife and Barcelona.
I love reading, especially fantasy. I've read works like Dune, A Song of Ice and Fire, The Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, among others.
I'm also a fan of superheroes and cinema — no rivalry between Marvel and DC, I enjoy the best of both universes.
These interests are part of who I am and help me maintain creativity, curiosity, and balance outside of code.

events.title: RECIPREV Project
